DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Cutaneous Squamous Cell Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for head and neck cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Tumor Clinical M Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the clinical M stage of a head and neck tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/29/21 TL Changed RS to Qualified. 6/23/21 TL received permission from Brian Campbell to transfer ownership from CTEP to NCI Standards; AK.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Head and Neck Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. It applies to cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck and all other nonmelanoma skin carcinomas of the head and neck (except Merkel cell carcinoma). It also applies to the adenocarcinomas that develop from eccrine or sebaceous glands and to the spindle cell variant of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
